member.name: LOGCOLORSPACE
member.summary: The LOGCOLORSPACE structure contains information that defines a logical color space.

member.name: LOGCOLORSPACE.lcsSignature
member.summary: Color space signature. At present, this member should always be set to LCS_SIGNATURE.

member.name: LOGCOLORSPACE.lcsSize
member.summary: Size of this structure, in bytes.

summary.para: Color space type. The member can be one of the following values.

listheader.description: Color values are calibrated RGB values. The values are translated using the endpoints specified by the lcsEndpoints member before being passed to the device.
Color values are values are sRGB values.
Color values are Windows default color space color values.

summary.para: If LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB is not specified, the lcsEndpoints member is ignored.
The gamut mapping method. This member can be one of the following values.

listheader.description: Maintain the white point. Match the colors to their nearest color in the destination gamut.
Maintain saturation. Used for business charts and other situations in which undithered colors are required.
Maintain colorimetric match. Used for graphic designs and named colors.
Maintain contrast. Used for photographs and natural images.

member.name: LOGCOLORSPACE.lcsFilename
member.summary: A null-terminated string that names a color profile file. This member is typically set to zero, but may be used to set the color space to be exactly as specified by the color profile. This is useful for devices that input color values for a specific printer, or when using an installable image color matcher. If a color profile is specified, all other members of this structure should be set to reasonable values, even if the values are not completely accurate.
